intro: Geum salvatoris, commonly known as the Alpine avens, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It features upright, branched stems that bear clusters of small, yellowish to reddish flowers. The plant has palmate leaves that are often hairy, adapted to withstand cold and harsh alpine conditions. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in alpine meadows and tundra environments. Geum salvatoris plays a role in supporting pollinators and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
